Still don't know what to think of this one. Is it "cheating play" or a play of cheating.  I took the wedding ring at the end as his having manned up and married her after she got a quickie divorce. Because she's sure as hell acting like this is NOT her husband. And there's that desperation that she has about her desire to get pregnant, which she wouldn't seem to have  if this was actually her hubby and they were RPing. And if they were RPing for him to get her pregnant, why the condoms to start things off? She's clearly very happy and satisfied with her life at the end. If this is actual cheating, the NTR only exists off stage, with no deliberate badmouthing of the husband. If this is role play, whatever. The one thing we're sure of is this: And she lived happily ever after with her husband (new or old) the MC.

@METROID 2.00 Even if it's not "NTR Play" by your definition, I won't be surprised if the actual artist (tanishi) think it is. NTR Play is directly referenced in page 9 if you see the condom brand. Also, the original title is "Yuugi" (which means Fake Play or Fabricated play), "Cheating Play" is what the translator decided to go with.
Other than the play clarification, this is still a hot scene. Strong 8/10, but the unclear nature makes me feel uneasy and the poster mistakenly tagged it as NTR. If it's play, then it isn't NTR
